Data.Name: North American Oriented Strand Board
Publisher: American Wood Council and Canadian Wood Council
Data.Description: OSB is manufactured by processing logs into wood strands, which are combined with resin and arranged in layers that alternate their orientation. The layers of strands and resin are then pressed into large sheets which are cut down to standard sizes. OSB is a versatile product that is used in a variety of applications. OSB is most commonly associated with the construction and renovation of single family homes. It is no surprise that commercial and residential construction consumes the greatest share of OSB relative to other uses. OSB is also increasingly being used in upholstered furniture manufacturing.
